Reviews.Title: Sony falsely advertises that this camera is waterproof
Reviews.Author: KW in MA
Reviews.Content: Sony's warranty is no good. I bought this camera for my vacation and used it in a pool. The camera leaked and stopped working. When I sent it to Sony they told me that they found corosion and the warranty was void. I told them that it was warranted to be waterproof and if the seals failed it should be covered. They just kept repeating their words and refused to honor their warranty. I will not purch from Sony again. Very disapointed in Sony.

Reviews.Title: This camara is not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Lin
Reviews.Content: I bought my Sony Cyber Shot DSC-TX10 and the first time in the beach, leaked and stopped working. I don't like that!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: juju82
Reviews.Content: So far I love everything about this camera, it auto adjusts to dark light, it takes great underwater pictures, the panorama is a really cool feature, I have no complaints at all!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera got water in it on trip to Galapagos...ruined!!
Reviews.Author: Karolyn Couch
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few months ago and used it quite a bit.  But the reason I ordered it was for our most recent trip to the Galapagos.  We went snorkeling and I used it on the first and second day and all was good.  The third day I used it I noticed that I could not get it to work once in the water.  When I got back to the ship I opened it up to take out the batter (figuring that the battery needed to be charged) only to have water come out!!  This camera is ruined, along with all of my photos on the memory card.  I always made sure that every compartment was closed and sealed before use, so I know it is nothing I did wrong. I am very upset as this was not a cheap camera!  I had to buy a Kodak disposable underwater camera to take pictures for the rest of the trip!

Reviews.Title: DETAILED COMPARISON OF SONY TX10 to Panasonic TS3
Reviews.Author: SammiMur
Reviews.Content: First, some background on what I was looking for:  I'm a casual photographer.  I wanted a waterproof camera which would produce high-quality photos in all settings (indoor, outdoor, and underwater.  My intention was to completely replace my 7.2MP Sony DSC-W7, which I LOVE.  I wanted to add the underwater feature without compromising on other features.  I did not want to spend more than about $400 for everything (camera, two 8GB memory cards (Class 10), two extra batteries with charger, and float strap.  This left me with about $340 max to spend on the camera itself.  I do NOT know a lot about photography.  Terms like "ISO" and "white balance" are foreign to me.  I like to use pre-programmed scene modes and auto features.  I enjoy digital scrapbooking and I frequently zoom and crop.  It takes a very high quality photo to crop out/enlarge a small figure without too much distortion.I began my search online and spent about 6 hours researching the cameras in my price range.  The cameras I focused on most were the Canon D10, Sony TX10, Panasonic TS3 (sometimes referred to as FT3), Olympus TG-810, Olympus Tough 8010, Fujifilm XP30, and Pentax WG-1.I eliminated most of these options rather quickly based on their reviews, overall ratings, and the quality of photos that I reviewed.  I narrowed my focus to the Canon D10, the Sony TX10, and the Panasonic TS3.I wanted to love the Canon D10, since it seems to be the overwhelming fan favorite, but I ultimately decided that it wasn't going to be a good fit for me.  The price of the D10 is similar to the Sony and the Panasonic, but it's a 2.5 year old model which doesn't have HD video.  The photo quality seemed about equivalent to the other two, so I decided to only focus on the two models with HD video.I would have been completely sold on the Sony, since I've used only Sony cameras most of my adult life and I've never been disappointed in one; however, there were some notable deficiencies which most reviewers found with this model (detailed below), so I was a bit hesitant to take the plunge.  The Sony was also priced near the top of my budget ($329), whereas the Panasonic was only $275 at Amazon.com.  The Panasonic reviews seemed to all be very positive, with the only significantly commonly-noted problem being lower quality indoor photos.  However, all of the indoor, outdoor, and underwater photos that I reviewed online looked very good.I decided to take a chance on the Panasonic TS3 and I really, really, wanted to fall in love with it.  I ordered it from Amazon and they delivered it the next day.  I wasn't blown away by this camera.  The outdoor photos were good.  The video was very good.  The underwater photos (taken in my large fish tank) were very good.  The indoor photos were POOR.  I decided to order the Sony TX10, hoping that I'd see better results.  I ordered it from Amazon at 9pm that night and it was delivered at 1:00pm the next day (gotta love Amazon!).  The photo quality of the Sony camera is outstanding.  I'll be keeping the Sony TX10!!!  For some people, however, the Panasonic might be the better choice.First, I'll provide my overall recommendations, then I'll add in all of the detail:BUY THE SONY TX10 IF:You value the quality of the photos/video above all else.You like touch screen devices.You don't plan to dive lower than 16 feet.You don't care if you can't adjust your settings (other than zoom) underwater.You want a VERY small camera.You always use a wrist strap.BUY THE PANASONIC TS3 IF:You can live with grainy indoor photos.You don't typically enlarge your photos to 100% (because they will be distorted).You want a camera with GPS.You plan to dive deeper than 16 feet.You want a larger (but not too big) camera.You're looking for a less expensive option.NOW FOR MY DETAILED COMMENTS ON BOTH MODELS:PRICE - The Sony is +/- $50 more expensive than the Panasonic.SIZE - The Sony is significantly smaller and lighter than the Panasonic.  I don't think one is better than the other, per se.  It's a matter of personal preference.  The Sony will fit in most pockets.  The Panasonic probably wouldn't.RUGGEDNESS - Both cameras are rated very well in this area.  I haven't "tested" them, but it seems like the Panasonic is built a bit tougher and would be less likely to get destroyed in a fall.  Rather than test this feature, I'm going to just trust the experts that either one will hold up well if dropped.

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: Kent
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised that this camera actually performs fairly well.  While there are limited options for manual functionality, it does what it needs to do taking photos.  For the casual photographer, does everything you want it to do.  It can also be a good companion to a DSLR as well.The camera's option to support SD & Memory Stick is a great option.  No longer do you have to be tied to proprietary Sony MS.  This is definitely a step forward.On with the camera itself, I found that it does not fair well with the flip the lid and take the shot movement.  It takes time to startup and focus.  This camera takes quite a bit of time to focus on an image.The preset functions built in are very useful.  Different useful modes do tailor to many daily activities.  The iSweep, is great for a quick panoramic shot.  The superior auto mode along with other preset modes takes several shots and merges them on the camera to produce a better image.The movie mode is pretty good on the camera.  While not as functional as a true video capturing device, this camera does the job at high quality.  The ability to take stills, zoom, while recording is a cool feature.  I dislike the fact that the camera needs to be in standby mode for  a few seconds before recording can begin.The 3D function is probably gimic'y and requires a 3D tv to view the content.  Thus it was useless.The waterproof feature has yet to be tested.  The shockproof wasn't so bad, the camera was dropped, got nicked but still functions properly.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!!! LOVES IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Benard
Reviews.Content: i pre-order the Sony Cyber-Shot tx10 for my wife March 3rd and I received it by UPS on Tuesday, April 5th. I bought her an extra battery and charger from the Sony store in Atlanta, GA right after i pre-order the camera. Only because the store was closing...I paid $10 for the extra battery and $18 for the charger. She original wanted the T99 in purple, comes to find out it was being discontinued, which i am glad caused otherwise she would not have the water proof feature, much as she love to swim. Just purchased a 3D Sony Bravia TV, which is PERFECT cause she can shoot 3D photos which turns out nice. Overall, she wanted this camera because she want something small to keep in her purse at all times. I have a DSLR camera which is kinda heavy and she hates carrying it around. The only downside is the camera does not have black & white photo option, not that she cares caused she don't uses the feature on my DSLR. Overall the camera is AWESOME!!!!!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA - UNDERWATER & ON DRY LAND
Reviews.Author: Kirsten Danielson "KD"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so much more than I hoped for...I have and love my Canon T2i with expensive lenses but it is much safer to take the Sony to the beach anyday and not worry about sand and water damge...I used the Sony on our cruise of the Caribbean and never took the T2i out of my camera case.Pros:1. It works underwater without any problem - be sure to clean it in fresh water after each use(instructions included with camera)2. It is small and easy to carry in your purse or pocket - buy the protective screen cover (2 for about $12-worth the investment)3. Panoramic pictures are just sweet!4. Hot pink color is just fun and touch screen screen works great.5. I bought it in a package so the memory card, camera case, cleaning stuff, etc came with it for $239, about the same as buying the camera seperately.Cons:1. As with all cameras with only a screen to view your subject, (no viewfinder), when ussed in bright sunlight, it is sometimes very difficult to see your subject and to change your picture mode since it is all touch screen.  I memorized where some of the main controls were on the screen and I was able to navigate between modes even without being able to read the detailed icons on the screen.  This is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, no USB cable
Reviews.Author: Cowland
Reviews.Content: I love the camera enough to buy a USB cable instead of returning it - but the cable is absolutely essential, since Sony uses a proprietary USB port and it's impossible to charge the battery without the cable.

Reviews.Title: Have owned it for a year so far, and love it!
Reviews.Author: Jillian C "J.R.C."
Reviews.Content: I go through so many cameras but ever since getting this one I haven't bought any camera since. I got it in the color pink, which I adore :) it's very light which surprised me at first and took time to get used to, its so light you think it will break if it falls but nope I dropped it 3 times on hard tile and it didn't even scratch! It has an amazing auto focus during video mode- I do YouTube videos I use it for hauls and makeup tutorials and my viewers have even asked me what dslr I use and they are stunned when they find out I'm using a simple point and shoot style camera! It's okay in very low lighting however it is not the best in very low lighting. The pictures it takes are very clear and detailed - the macro shots are BEAUTIFUL! I mainly got this for videos, I've been using it for a year now and it's still working just like it was when I first got it. I even took it underwater - for those who say this is not waterproof then they must have not followed the directions. You can not take it in salt water or under 6 feet of water or have it in very forceful water example- putting it in a waterfall would not be a good idea. I used it to go in my fish tank so I could get good pictures of my fish and even underwater the picture quality is amazing! Now wait for the cameras mic to dry out before making a video :) it only takes 1-3 hours for the mic to dry out. I use a HD memory card as well. Overall this camera is fantastic! It's very durable believe me since I dropped it a lot lol plus it comes in nice colors :)

Reviews.Title: Sony - Good Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Preston
Reviews.Content: I was originally going to give this camera four stars.  However, after I used it for a couple of months, and, got used to its features, I decided that five stars was more appropriate.My first "point and shoot" is an ancient SONY DSC T33 (5.1 Mp) Sony Cybershot DSCT33 5.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Includes Docking Station) I bought about five years ago.  It is a little beat up, but, it has worked really well, and, continues to work really well.  I love it.  I wouldn't have bought a new camera except I misplaced it for a few months and needed a new one.This camera DSC-TX10, provides three times the resolution, and I am really happy with the higher resolution.  It's hard to take a bad picture because, with the high resolution, you can electronically crop most photos into award-winning pictures, and the remaining cropped image still has plenty of resolution.This is a camera you can stick in your pocket, and, take with you, all the time.  It is compact, lightweight, sturdy enough to take jolts, bumps and an occasional fall.  You can keep it in "easy mode" for almost instant "point and shoots", and, it will stay in easy mode until you exit into the more complicated functions.  I cherish the simplicity.  I have 22 years of education, and, many years of technical experience.  I am no "technophobe".  However, as I mature, I find my life bleeding away and I don't want to spend it buried in technical manuals for gadgest that are supposed to be enhancing my life, and, giving me more time for important things.This camera does the job.

Reviews.Title: I've had this everywhere with me since 2011.
Reviews.Author: J. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this camera. Since I do like it very much, I'll start with the Cons!-Paint is ~~easily~~ scratched. If you plan on getting this thing out at the beach be very careful about sand getting into the sliding front. I am OCD as hell and mine still managed a scratch when I took one second to not pay attention.-The battery life is TERRIBLE on video mode. I easily breeze through my 3 batteries with this.-It shoots double-photos ALL the time. Not sure if it's a software issue, but I can't seem to turn it off. Second photo is always horrible.-It has some issues thinking it can be in Macro all the time.-The panoramic and 3D shots are "cute" but not good quality.-Shaky images, pet photos take patience! And a well-trained little mutt to keep still long enough!-Not a great quality when zooming.-NO MANUAL SETTINGS! You can adjust the WB a little, a little exposure, but nothing, and I mean nothing important comes from this camera if you want control of your images. It's simply a Point-And-Shoot to any extent.Now if you still care,Pros:I love it. It's tiny, easily fits into my bag with it's little case, and easily can bring along my 3 batteries, and a couple extra SD cards.Never had any issues with it destroying SDs, my old camera bricked a few.Batteries are very cheap for it. Tiny tripod is as well, which is nearly a must for keeping this camera still if you have shaky hands.Crisp images. Hi res. Plenty of settings and sizes for images. A couple for video.Very easy to use. Dummy proof. Very fun still with the settings even for those who know how to use a manual camera.Works best in high light, outdoors, can take very clear images of quick-shutter when enough light is provided.It's just.. really really convenient, and all my other cameras have had some sort of issue after 2.5 years of HEAVY use.No issues with weather, battery corrosion, software (other than double-shots), and it's just my little workhorse.Videos look and sound fantastic. Minimal wind noise. It's actually a really strong mic, too.It doesn't make any "scary" noises like lens sounds or have any strange notification beeps that could possibly ward off wilderness shots.Finally, it IS Waterproof. I check the seal every time before putting it into water. It's been in Mexico and Florida's oceans, as well as a few pools and fish tanks. I have had -zero- leaks. It's also tiny enough to go into a small waterproof wallet-bag, which I admit I used one the first couple times out of paranoia.I admit, it could be very easy for the seal to become compromised.And it is a shame, but the standard warranty (1 year) that comes with the camera is a Sony Basic Plan. They can easily tell you that it is impossible for them to care about your water-related issue, because it is a bulk warranty, and simply means that you throwing cocacola on your HDTV means they don't have to fix it for you. For an item like this, the warranty really should be revised... But they don't have to and obviously don't care to. Even if it's supposed to be advertised for being in the water, they are being kind of jerks about it. So I feel sorry for those who have had issues.If you are worried, be like crazy me and spend a little extra on the 3 year ADH protection plan that does include water damage. It might be worthwhile. Especially if you plan on keeping it a long time like I have.Sorry for the long amount of text! This camera really does have its ups and downs, but I think if you just need something reliable for your purse, bike/hiking, vacation, etc.. I think it has been worth my money, many times over!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SWENS
Reviews.Content: This camera's awesome, I read its not really waterproof, which was a concern so we don't take in the water, but I take it fishing with me all the time, great self timer with face recognition. A ton of features, crystal clear Zeiss Lens and the software is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: A. Cheng
Reviews.Content: Love the color and all functions, easy to control and not easy to break. Love this item, specially during summer time.

Reviews.Title: Love this cam!
Reviews.Author: Sarah S. "Sarah"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's cute, it's pink, it's girly. I also like the fact that it is an underwater camera. Yup, you can used under the water so that makes it cool :)

Reviews.Title: returned
Reviews.Author: Paulette T Romanik
Reviews.Content: this did not work arrived defective returned it ... fast and convenient returns good service. I only wish the product was better.

Reviews.Title: This camera is really nice!!
Reviews.Author: vivi
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera! I already let it fall down, let it get wet and also lost this camera in the middle of the snow, and it still perfect, just has some scratches, but work good and has a lot of different options to choose to take pics.

Reviews.Title: sony cybershot dsc tx10 16.2 mp waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Barinotti
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I let my kids go play with it in the pool (11 & 9) and it was also great in the ocean. I have used it outside in the snow, night time, and in hot weather...it doesn't fog up from going in the house to outside in the snow, it's awesome!  I researched a lot of cameras before buying this one and I have not been sorry at all!

Reviews.Title: DECEIVED BY PRODUCT DESCRIPTION
Reviews.Author: Ohsaycanuz
Reviews.Content: Theses cameras are NOT waterproof. The gasket area/latch were fine before snorkling. The camara was submerged no deeper than 3 feet above the surface. I was in the water for less than 30 minutes. The battery compartment was flooded. Yes the latch remained closed the entire time. The camera does not turn on with a new battery. I am very displeased to read that Sony will not honor it's product nor strike Waterproof from it's description.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Tinks
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera a little over a year now and i absolutely love it ! ... had an issue with it earlier this year ... it refused to charge but when i took it to fix, the charger was apparantly defective. But other than that ... it takes really good pictures, the underwater feature works great. I most definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CAMERA; HORRIBLE SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Ping Porsche
Reviews.Content: WHY CAN'T I GIVE NEGATIVE STARS?DON'T BUY THIS OR ANY OTHER SONY CAMERA!!!!!Sony makes crap cameras and their support will accuse you of breaking it.Purchase from a respectable camera maker like Canon, Nikon, or Fuji.I bought this for snorkeling and it corrupted my memory card on the first trip.OK, $10,000 trip with no pictures, because the camera corrupted the memory.Called Sony and they blamed the memory.Got two new memory cards for the next trip.OK, new trip, $5k trip with no pictures because the entire stupid camera craps out.Called Sony, no apologies, no emergency loaner, just a send it in with the receipt so we can verify it's still under warranty.Sent the camera in to the depot, on my own dime.They call and accused me of opening the camera door.What idiots! Why the hell would I do that? So I can ruin my pictures?  TWICE????!!!!!I contacted all the way up to national customer support.All idiots along the way.They didn't do a user test underwater.They just dunk it and say it's still WATER-RESISTANT, so it must be user error.F#$% OFF SONY!!!!Whatever you do, buy something else and save your money, this is a horrible product, that takes horrible pictures and is slow as mud, with a horrible touchscreen that doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: disappointed with everything (almost)
Reviews.Author: 808photo
Reviews.Content: So I live in Hawaii where we are constantly camping, surfing, jumping off cliffs etc. and wanted a camera that can handle my lifestyle.  I formerly owned the Sony TX9 which is an absolutely wonderful camera to work with.  Im into photography, and creating a nice photo, but often dont want to be carrying around a bulky camera.  This camera (tx9) wasnt much more than another cell phone, which I liked.  The touch screen response was amazing! I loved the interface, navigating photos and settings were effortless.  And just the speed of operation in the camera was excellent, looking through photos was instant. From the moment i slide the shutter down, to when I can take a pic, was surprisingly quick.  All these things are what I expected and more from the TX10.  This is not what I got though.  Even from the 1st day of operation, i didnt like the response of the touch screen.  It was almost like you had to wait after touching it so it could process. This was the same way I felt when looking through pictures! I dont know if sony put a lower quality "processor" in the TX10, but in every aspect of operation, thats how it seems. Then at 7 months, the touch screen just kinda stopped working intermittently.  Now at 8 months, it completely failed.  Also, the camera says that the battery is not a compatible accessory, or to use a sony battery (the one I use came with the camera) which then makes the camera shut off. If this camera were to operate as it should, it would be a truly amazing camera, because it does take really nice photos for a tiny camera.  Also, you might not even notice that the camera lags, and just assume that's just how its supposed to be, but since I did have the previous model, and know how it should be responding, I am not impressed. So disappointing, because the TX9 was a trooper for almost 2 years, and still operated like brand new, til I dropped it in water (hense the reason I got a "waterproof" camera).Bottom line is, the TX10 just didnt feel right, especially coming from the quality I knew to expect from its previous model.  Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: broken already! Sony wants to charge me MORE than the value of the camera to fix it!!
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: Had this camera less than a year and it won't work!! I dropped the camera from 2 feet off the ground- on to carpet!- and I got a green screen of death. The lens is broken (I'm assuming) and it won't even turn on now. I've tried everything I can think of and the Sony people want me to send it in so they can fix it for a whoping $300!!! I don't think so.Haven't had a problem with water, but then I've only used it while snorkeling in shallow water.

Reviews.Title: Camera Amazing, Warranty Not So Much
Reviews.Author: msm
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on a Black Friday Special so I got it for a great deal. The camera is awesome. It takes photos well, the blur feature is super cool, and it also works well underwater. The only cons about this camera are that it is hard to dry after getting it wet due to the slide front feature, and the warranty is terrible. I purchased the camera in November and it is now September. After following all instructions, I took the camera in the water and it leaked. I sent the camera in and was told that my warranty was voided because they found "particles" in the sealing mechanism. I know that there were no particles because I am extra careful about taking my camera in the water since I had an Olympus before which leaked. The Laredo repair facility could not specify what the particles were and wanted me to pay them $50 for repairs. After more haggling over the warranty I was told that the camera was irreparable. Wait a minute, weren't you just trying to charge me $50 to repair it, now you're telling me that there is no way to repair this item?I don't trust the warranty and may not purchase a Sony underwater-camera product again, unless it is from Best Buy which has an amazing warranty you can purchase for a few dollars more. Again, the camera rocks! but the warranty sucks.

Reviews.Title: Not a waterproof camera.
Reviews.Author: Brazilian in Houston
Reviews.Content: Works well in the pool, but brought to the beach one day and now it turns on, but won't take pictures.  Will be looking for a better replacement waterproof camera that I can bring to the beach.

Reviews.Title: takes great pics, when it works
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for x-mas of 2010, I used maybe 3 times and noticed cracks on the edges (There is a piece that holds the screen on) on the side where the wrist strap is. I called Sony and they told me send it back, at my cost. The camera was gone for over a month becauase the part was on back order, which was not a good sign. Upon getting the camera back the FIRST time I used it the same cracks where back!!! My guess is the weight of the camera when hanging from the wrist strap put tension on that piece and it cracks, either way no good. When contacting Sony this time they sent me a label to pay for the shipping, which is great BUT the camera should NOT have broke again and after an hour or so of use! I now have my camera back and I am scared to use it, so in the end while it does take great pictures and I LOVE THE BACKROUND defocus setting its NOT a good buy. Not as advertised as a "tough" camera.As far as it being waterproof, considering all above I will not dare try it. The menu and photo editing features are great, and aside from the cracks I LOVE the camera, but really its not built well.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: fintroller
Reviews.Content: So far so good. Used it daily for the last week. Underwater photos were awesome. Used it about 30-45 minutes while snorkeling with video and photos. Panoramic pics are great.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: darkmusiqfaerie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item when I saw it go on sale for black Friday. I LOVE this camera! The pictures are clear and there are many options (easy, auto, superior, panorama). I usually leave it on superior and that takes care of pics inside and outside. What I love most about this camera (besides the clear pictures) is that it is waterproof! I am not afraid to have it around my little nephews (ages 4-12). There has been incidents where I have dropped this camera and have spilled water on it and it works just as great as the day I took it out of the box.I definitely recommend this camera and I would definitely purchase again! (P.S. this is my 3rd cyber-shot... no other camera has measured up!)

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Bianca B
Reviews.Content: This camera is so great. It has awesome features and special effects. This magenta/pink color is just beautiful and the picture quality is amazing! The touch screen works very well, and it comes with a pen if you would like to use that instead of your fingers. Definitely recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: The Best of its Class
Reviews.Author: Maria Liliany L. Costa "lilicaland"
Reviews.Content: I believe it was one of my most fulfilling purchases in the camera category. Does exactly what it promises to do. I am 100% satisfied.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: pink
Reviews.Content: Like this camera, small lightweight. Had trouble figuring out how to review pictures, guess I'll need to review instructions. Would reccomend to friend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Henrylike
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, got it with the Lightning deal price, worth much more then i paid. Great camera very durable! I Highly Reccomend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: great design. love it
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: very good camera. I can use it even under the water. I like the fabulous design and the pink color. would like to recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Maya
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's absolutly adorable. I haven't used it underwater and i am not sure if i will since i am to scared to mess it up. However it takes beautiful pictures

Reviews.Title: goodgood
Reviews.Author: cecilia
Reviews.Content: i feel so good,very nice,much beautiful,i could share with my friend and i would buy one more for my sister if the same price

Reviews.Title: Wow.. this thing is ridiculous!
Reviews.Author: artbotfd3s
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend as a Christmas gift. She loves it, though I think I love it more. This thing is fantastic. I got it to replace her older camera, not only is this one smaller, but it is packed with so many features that it's almost unbeliveable. What I'm dying to try out is the waterproofing, that's next on the agenda. Overall excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Sont Cyber-Shot DSC-TX10
Reviews.Author: bambino
Reviews.Content: My wife is very happy with this item, it was an excelent purchase. you get a fair price than you adquire.

Reviews.Title: The best deal
Reviews.Author: TenaGirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on black friday and it was a really good deal, since it's Sony, it's quality is excellent, it has so many features and functions that I almost can't believe the price I paid for it. The pictures are of the best quality, I love the panoramic pictures I take, I can take shots under water, record HQ movies, take 3D pictures..... it's everything you need in a digital pocket camera. I recommend to buy a Sony Pro-HG Duo HX memory card,Sony 8 GB PRO-HG Duo HX Memory Stick MSHX8A (Black) because with SD card the camera works a little bit slow.

Reviews.Title: LOVEEE
Reviews.Author: A. Cheney "goldrushbeauty"
Reviews.Content: Been wanting this camera for a while, cNet raves about it & I was not disappointed!!! It's small but Powerful & takes Perfect pictures every time!! :)

Reviews.Title: Scared to use it underwater
Reviews.Author: Saira Nepomuceno "Photography Dreamer"
Reviews.Content: I finally got this camera on a Gold Box Deal of the Day but am very scared to use it underwater because I dropped it once and the battery case opened! So how sure am I that that won't happen underwater? And if it does open and the camera breaks, Sony won't give me a warranty for that. :( I don't know what to do currently.

Reviews.Title: Very good underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: After researching waterproof cameras, I came upon this little gem of a camera.  Wow!  The clarity is superb, video quality is awesome and I would highly recommend for anyone looking to purchase a waterproof camera.  The start up time that most people complain about is no big deal.  The only problem I have with this camera is the fact that they don't send you a charger to charge the battery outside of the camera.  Stupid little accessory you need to purchase.  Annoying considering you're spending more than $300 for it.  Would I buy again if needed?  Most definitely for the quality of the photos and video and it's waterproof.  We will see if half years time if I need to update this review.

Reviews.Title: Sony proprietary USB cable meant no vacation photos..
Reviews.Author: Mike Patnode
Reviews.Content: The camera takes fantastic photos and video for its size.  Easy and fun to use and you simply can't beat the shutter lag (IE: it takes fast photos).  Haven't tested the waterproofness yet, but from other reviews sounds like you don't want to push your luck.  My only complaint, and the reason I rated this a 3 instead of 5 is the proprietary USB cable connection needed for charging.  We accidentally picked up the Blackberry cable when packing (which is standard micro-USB) I also had a standard mini-USB in my computer bag, but Sony invented their own so they could charge their customers another $20 for it.  The camera battery was dead when we arrived in Yosemite, and we had no way to charge it.  Quite frustrating.Amazon has an OEM version for 9.99: ABC Products® replacement Sony VMC-MD3 VMCMD3 USB Cable Cord for Cyber-Shot DSC-H70, DSC-HX7, DSC-HX9, DSC-HX100, DSC-T99, DSC-T110, DSC-TX5, DSC-TX10, DSC-TX100, DSC-W350, DSC-W360, DSC-W380, DSC-W390, DSC-W560, DSC-W570, DSC-W580, DSC-WX5, DSC-WX7, DS... but it still irritates me to no end that Sony didn't go with a standard connection.  I also recommend you buy a few extra batteries Sony NP-BN1 Compatible Li-ion Battery and a stand alone charger, since the battery life is pretty low.Updated: 12/29One more irritating Sony "feature" is this camera does NOT appear as a standard USB disk when you plug it in to a computure.  Once again Sony created a proprietary driver that makes it difficult to move the photos off the camera.  Also, they store the videos in another directory with all sorts of meta data files that can't be used without the Sony conversion software.  This is the main reason I didn't buy the Sony NEX when I upgraded to a DSLR.  I just knew they would do more screwy stuff like that.

Reviews.Title: Excelente compra y buen vendedor
Reviews.Author: Herman "OSHO"
Reviews.Content: La compra de este artículo fue muy buena, no faltó nada y estoy muy satisfecho con el precio y todo lo que incluye.Gracias.
